content.raw:
`<from_your_haptix-comm-repo>sh tools/code_check.sh` (you need cppcheck installed).

But this is not going to work because we are not parsing the `matlab` directory. If you look into `code_check.sh` there's a variable for specifying the directories that the checker needs to check (`CHECK_DIRS`). I played a little bit with that variable and with the `CPPCHECK_FILES` variable but for some reason didn't work. So, my workaround to see the output was to copy `hxgz.c` into the `src/` directory and renamed to `.cc`. 

And about the spacing, we don't usually have the space before the opening parenthesis but probably not a big deal.
content.html:
<from_your_haptix-comm-repo>sh tools/code_check.sh (you need cppcheck installed).

But this is not going to work because we are not parsing the matlab directory. If you look into code_check.sh there's a variable for specifying the directories that the checker needs to check (CHECK_DIRS). I played a little bit with that variable and with the CPPCHECK_FILES variable but for some reason didn't work. So, my workaround to see the output was to copy hxgz.c into the src/ directory and renamed to .cc.

And about the spacing, we don't usually have the space before the opening parenthesis but probably not a big deal.
